name: David Bradway
body:

# Current and Prior Research Groups
* [JÃ¸rgen A. Jensen, Center for Fast Ultrasound Imaging (DTU)](http://www.cfu.elektro.dtu.dk)
* [Gregg E. Trahey, Acoustic Radiation Force Impulse Imaging (Duke University)](http://www.bme.duke.edu/faculty/gregg-e-trahey)
* [Tissue Strain Analytics (Siemens)](http://www.healthcare.siemens.com/ultrasound/tissue-strain-analytics)
* [D. Geoff Vince, VH Intravascular Ultrasound (Cleveland Clinic Foundation and Volcano Corp.)](http://www.lerner.ccf.org/bme/innovations)

# About Me
I received my B.S. degree in Electrical and Computer Engineering from the Ohio State University, Columbus, OH, in 2005. I was an NSF Graduate Research Fellow and received my Ph.D. degree in Biomedical Engineering from Duke University in 2013. I am currently a Whitaker International Program postdoctoral scholar in Biomedical Engineering at the Technical University of Denmark (DTU) in Lyngby, Denmark. My research interests include vector flow imaging, GPU computing, acoustic radiation force imaging, and diagnostic ultrasonic imaging.

# Current and Prior Funding Sources
* [Whitaker International Program](http://www.whitaker.org)
* [NSF Graduate Research Fellowship Prorgam](http://www.nsfgrfp.org)
* [The Barry Goldwater Scholarship and Excellence in Education Program](https://goldwater.scholarsapply.org)
